Description: Scarab made of steatite, almost completely preserved, only a small part at the base is chipped off. The steatite is of a grey colour, few remains of a whitish glaze visible. The division between head and prothorax is shown by a single line. The division between prothorax and elytra as well as the suture is shown in a double line. Both prothorax and elytra show a lateral framing line on each side. The humeral callosities are shown by incised triangles, only faintly visible anymore. The head is oval in shape, the eyes are shown. The clypeus is broken off, the plates are visible. The side shows three fully carved legs on each side, sitting on a base plate, no further details shown. The seal at the base shows a thin oval line framing the base. Inside a squatting cat facing to the right, over its back a fish, also facing to the right. In front of the cat a wDA.t-eye with a brow, above it a sun disc. The motif is oriented transversal, while the perforation is longitudinal.
